Posts.Content: Thanks Sue, I'll perhaps go and see my GP as I can never seem to get hold of my BC nurse. You look after yourself too. Xx
Posts.Title: Anyone else had trouble with arm and fingers swelling on and off ...

Posts.Content: Morning all, Wonder if anyone can help? I had lumpectomy and snb three weeks ago. I have very good movement in my arm and shoulder but I have found my lower arm and fingers swell intermitterntly. Just wondered is this normal?   I only had two nodes removed so I feel abit of a cry baby when many of you are going through so much more.  Many thanks Louise. x
Posts.Title: Anyone else had trouble with arm and fingers swelling on and off ...

Posts.Content: Thanks for that Carole, I have no idea when I see him again, he h just refered me for radiotherapy...   he was very odd, it was almost like he didn't want to speak... I suppose I should have thrown more questions at him but it kind of took me back abit as chemo has never been mentioned before. It's always the way you think of loads of things once you have left. I feel upst to tell you the truth because is radiotherapy going to be enough to make sure it's gone...  Like you said they are the experts... Why ask me.... ? I wish you well with your appointment, make sure you make a list of questions to take with you. I didn't because I thought I knew what they were going to say.... Louise X
Posts.Title: Confused.......

Posts.Content: I have just had my first appointment with the oncologist today. I went in thinking I knew my treatment plan : Radiotherapy for three weeks and tamoxifen for five years according to my surgeon whom I have alot of faith in. My oncologist confirmed the tamoxifen and radiotherapy for three and a half weeks !!!   but having chemo was up to me as I am over 40  ( I'm 43 ) and he would give it if I wanted it, had I have been under 40 he would have done it anyway. Where did that come from? No one has every mentioned chemo before. I had a lumpectomy and sentinel node biopsy four weeks ago.  Results were clear margins with no node involvement. Lump was small under 2cm. I just feel lost now...  Do I need chemo?  Oncologist just looked at me and said 'it's up to you'..... 'we have probably already got it all'.... What do you lovely ladies think? Louise X
Posts.Title: Confused.......

Posts.Content: Have just spoken to my BC nurse. She said during the mdt meeting there was no mention of chemo in my treatment plan. She is going to check out his notes and call me Monday. My tumour was only 7mm with pre cancerous cells upto 17mm and it was grade 2. Perhaps you are right about the grade, I don't know. I hope my BC nurse will be able to make things clearer for me Monday. Kicking myself now for not coming out with all the questions going through my mind now.... My oncologist didn't say much at all really and I was kind of stunned into silence. Still shocked by it all really.... Louise X
Posts.Title: Confused.......

Posts.Content: Thanks ladies for your replies, I didn't sleep well last night...... I really do not know what to think, it may well be down to the stage and grade which has been pointed out in this thread.  Mine was grade 2 and stage 1. So like I've said was told right from the start treatment would just be surgery, tamoxifen and three weeks radiotherapy. So that's why I still can't get my head around the comment from the oncologist ' I wasn't going to give chemo unless you want it, it is your choice. '  I'm a night manager in Tesco, how do I know what is the best course of treatment for me !!  I think no one would opt for chemo through choice but would through necessity of beating this bloody awful disease. Perhaps I will wait for my BC nurse to call on Monday with the broken down version of his notes, she may well be able to describe to me why chemo has come onto the radar now. Louise X
Posts.Title: Confused.......

Posts.Content: Hi Jan,  My first time on here.  I think I too have grade 1. Found lump myself end of January, went to breast clinic, had biopsy, went back 3 days later, told I have invasive bc. I had lumpectomy last Friday and was told that I will need radiotherapy but haven't been told anymore than that so I feel a little like you. Not yet been given my appointment for results. I've not seen or spoken to anyone since coming home Friday night. Like you I don't feel I want to bother anyone with so many going through so much more than me. Now I'm rambling...... Thanks  Louise. x
Posts.Title: looking for grade 1 to share info

Posts.Content: Thanks Helen, I think I mean stage 1 not grade 1. I don't really know. Still don't think I've taken it in. My lump was very small only 6mm and invasive, that's all I and I suppose anyone knows until I get results in a couple of weeks. Everyone keeps asking about my treatment and the truth is I have no idea..... I hate the not knowing. I'll remember to take my book. Thanks again Louise x
Posts.Title: looking for grade 1 to share info

Posts.Content: Thank you.  Mistymoley. x
Posts.Title: looking for grade 1 to share info

Posts.Content: Hi Jan, Yes they took my Sentinal node which they said looked fine so they left it at just the one. My arm did swell the first night home but seems ok now, I've had more problems with the dressings than the wounds themselves, they brought me out in sores and blisters !!!!  so we removed them at home the day after op, I did check with gp just to make sure that it was ok. Wasn't given a list of can do's and can't or time lines. My BC nurse did say not to hoover. I couldn't help myself yesterday thou my boys just don't get the cleaning thing... lol.  I phoned our car insurance company who said no time line on driving just that it's ok to drive when  you feel you are in full control of the car. My 10 year old was going to help lots but seems to have had enough of that now so never mind typical boy... lol Going to try and walk the dog today not done that myself since last Thursday. I'm in Norfolk not far from Norwich. Louise x
Posts.Title: looking for grade 1 to share info

Posts.Content: Thanks londongurl. I will ring BC. All I keep doing is feeling the flipping thing and thinking OMG .......
Posts.Title: Hard lump under lumpectomy scar ?

Posts.Content: Just rang the BC nurses and they have booked me into clinic next Thursday, she said she was sure it was nothing to worry about but that it would put my mind at rest. Lets hope so.......
Posts.Title: Hard lump under lumpectomy scar ?

Posts.Content: Thanks guys, yes I will ring BC nurse.  I'm so sorry you are having to fight this all over again Hsalmons. Stay strong my love.
Posts.Title: Hard lump under lumpectomy scar ?

Posts.Content: Thanks Elaine :-) It's just that it seems to have grown !!!   or maybe that's all in my mind, now about the size of a penny. I will feel much better once I have seen the BC nurses next week in clinic. Louise. X
Posts.Title: Hard lump under lumpectomy scar ?

Posts.Content: Just an update .... Went to see BC nurse at the hospital Thursday. She had a good poke and feel around and said I'll just go and get the doctor.. The doctor had a good feel and poke, didn't think it was anything to worry about because of the time scales involved, ( I had lumpectomy March and finished radiotherapy in May ). Wouldn't commit to what it could be but has now ordered an ultrasound, awaiting appointment as they couldn't do it Thursday. Still feel a bit nervous about it. Just going to have to wait and see... Louise X
Posts.Title: Hard lump under lumpectomy scar ?

Posts.Content: Not been on here for a while but had lump removed March 2012, finished radiotherapy May 2012, on tamoxifen and now seem to have a hard lump under my scar.... Is this normal?  I'm thinking that it must be scar tissue. Went to gp who wasn't really interested and just looked at it and just agreed with me 'that's what it must be.' Still waiting for my oncology follow up which is in 3 weeks time. I will ask when I see him but was wondering Anyone else had anything like this? Please and thank you. Louise X
Posts.Title: Hard lump under lumpectomy scar ?

Posts.Content: Thanks guys I will give them a call tomorrow. I must say it is on my mind.....   I only have to run my finger over it very lightly and it's there !!  Feels like a boulder..  of cause it's not but certainly bigger than original lump.. Cheers guys, now of for my night shift... Louise X
Posts.Title: Hard lump under lumpectomy scar ?

Posts.Content: Thanks londongurl. I will ring BC. All I keep doing is feeling the flipping thing and thinking OMG .......

Posts.Title: Hard lump under lumpectomy scar ?

Posts.Content: Oh bless you. I didn't have chemo, oncologist told me it was upto me if I took up chemo or not.... I said no.... I will have my fingers and toes crossed for you. They told me they can't see how it could be anything to worry about because of the time scales ie/ only6 months since op. I'll keep you posted on how it goes. Louise xx
